section.title: Overview
section.lines: This page describes the ENM SED Use External NFS feature in the Deployment Inventory Tool. It describes what the purpose of this feature is, how it works at a high level.

section.title: Purpose Of This Feature
section.lines: The ENM SED has a number of key values associated with both external and internal NFS. The 'Use External NFS' feature comprises of a checkbox in the ENM SED document view which allows a user of DIT to view and populate only key value fields that are associated with the selected NFS solution for a given deployment. While a user of DIT can view and edit the associated key values based on the selected NFS solution, the alternative NFS solution key values are hidden from view and are auto populated with default inactive state values.

section.title: External NFS key values
section.lines:
DIT identifies external NFS associated key values via reference to the following schema definitions. Any key values found in the ENM SED schema that match these definitions for external NFS defined below will be editable by a user of DIT on ENM SED edit document view when the 'Use External NFS' checkbox is checked. When the 'Use External NFS' checkbox is unchecked any key values for external NFS found in the ENM SED schema that match these definitions will not be editable or visible in the edit ENM SED document view and will be auto populated with inactive default values.
Warning: The deletion or renaming of schema definitions in the enm sed schema detailed below will result undesired behaviour and or failure of the 'Use External NFS' feature. Any changes to the enm sed schema definitions detailed below will required a subquent update to functionality of DIT to ensure the Use External NFS feature continues to perform as expected.

section.title: Internal NFS key values
section.lines:
DIT identifies internal NFS associated key values via reference to the following schema definitions. Any key values found in the ENM SED schema that match these definitions for internal NFS defined below will be editable by a user of DIT on ENM SED edit document view when the 'Use External NFS' checkbox is unchecked. When the 'Use External NFS' checkbox is checked any key values for internal NFS found in the ENM SED schema that match these definitions will not be editable or visible in the edit ENM SED document view and will be auto populated with inactive default values on saving the document.
Warning: The deletion or renaming of schema definitions in the enm sed schema detailed below will result undesired behaviour and or failure of the 'Use External NFS' feature. Any changes to the enm sed schema definitions detailed below will required a subquent update to functionality of DIT to ensure the 'Use External NFS' feature continues to perform as expected.

section.title: When It Runs
section.lines: On selection of the desired NFS solution via the 'Use External NFS' feature checkbox in ENM SED edit document view, the required NFS key values are made editable in the create ENM SED edit document view. The alternative NFS soultion key values which are not required will not appear in the ENM SED document view nor will they be available to edit by a user of DIT. On save of ENM SED document the unrequired key values are saved with inactive default values.
